TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RoutedEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

summary.span: 包含与路由事件相关联的状态信息和事件数据。

span.span: Contains state information and event data associated with a routed event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以将不同的与单个一起使用。Different can be used with a single . 此类负责将的事件数据打包, 提供额外的事件状态信息, 并由事件系统用来调用与路由事件关联的处理程序。This class is responsible for packaging the event data for a , providing extra event state information, and is used by the event system for invoking the handler associated with the routed event.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此无参数构造函数时, 新实例的所有公共属性都采用以下默认值:When using this parameterless constructor, all public properties of the new instance assume the following default values: - 默认值`null`为。 defaults to `null`. - 默认为`false` defaults to `false` - 默认值`null`为。 defaults to `null`. - 默认值`null`为。 defaults to `null`. 和 的 Null 值仅意味着数据不会尝试指定源。Null values for and only mean that the data makes no attempt to specify the source. 当在对的调用中使用此实例时 , 将根据引发事件的元素填充和值, 并通过路由将其传递到侦听器。When this instance is used in a call to , the and values are populated based on the element that raised the event and are passed on to listeners through the routing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此重载构造函数时, 新实例的未指定属性将假定以下默认值:When using this overloaded constructor, unspecified properties of the new instance assume the following default values: - 默认为`false` defaults to `false` - 默认值`null`为。 defaults to `null`. 的 Null 值基于引发事件并通过路由传递的元素进行填充, 但会在调用之前被读取`null` 。Null values for are populated based on the element that raised the event and passed on through the routing, but will read `null` prior to invocation. 传递到虚方法(如) 时使用此签名, 其中使用参数在内部调用 。Use this signature when passing to virtuals such as , where the arguments are used to call internally.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Handled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Handled : bool with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示针对路由事件（在其经过路由时）的事件处理的当前状态。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates the present state of the event handling for a routed event as it travels the route.

value.span: 设置的时候，如果事件将标记为已处理，则设置为 ；否则为 。

span.span: If setting, set to if the event is to be marked handled; otherwise .

value.span: 如果读取此值， 指示沿路由的一个类处理程序或某个实例处理程序已将此事件标记为已处理。

span.span: If reading this value, indicates that either a class handler, or some instance handler along the route, has already marked this event handled.

value.span: .指示没有这类处理程序将该事件标记为已处理。

span.span: .indicates that no such handler has marked the event handled.
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将事件标记为已处理会将路由事件的可见性限制为沿着事件路由的侦听器。Marking the event handled will limit the visibility of the routed event to listeners along the event route. 该事件仍会传递路由的其余部分, 但只有在`HandledEventsToo` 方法调用中专门添加的`true`处理程序才会在响应中调用。The event does still travel the remainder of the route, but only handlers specifically added with `HandledEventsToo` `true` in the method call will be invoked in response. 实例侦听器上的默认处理程序 (例如, 用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)]来表示的处理程序) 将不会被调用。Default handlers on instance listeners (such as those expressed in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)]) will not be invoked. 处理标记为已处理的事件并非常见方案。Handling events that are marked handled is not a common scenario. 如果你是控件作者定义自己的事件, 则在类级别对事件处理做出的决策将影响你的控件的用户以及派生控件的任何用户, 以及你的控件包含的其他元素。或包含控件的。If you are a control author defining your own events, the decisions you make regarding event handling at the class level will impact users of your control as well as any users of derived controls, and potentially other elements that are either contained by your control or that contain your control. 有关详细信息，请参阅[将路由事件标记为“已处理”和类处理](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/marking-routed-events-as-handled-and-class-handling.md)。For more information, see [Marking Routed Events as Handled, and Class Handling](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/marking-routed-events-as-handled-and-class-handling.md). 在极少数情况下 , 适合处理标记`true`为的事件, 并通过将更改为来`false`修改事件参数。In very rare circumstances it is appropriate to handle events where is marked `true`, and modify the event arguments by changing to `false`. 在控件输入事件的某些区域中, 这可能是必需的, 例如, 对的键处理方式为, 其中, 低级别和高级别的输入事件争用处理, 每个都尝试使用不同的路由策略。This can be necessary in certain areas of input events of controls, such as key handling of versus where low level and high level input events compete for the handling, and each is attempting to work with a different routing strategy. ## Examples 下面的示例实现一个将事件标记为已处理的事件处理程序。The following example implements an event handler that marks the event handled. [!code-csharp[ClassHandling#OnStarClassHandler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClassHandling/CSharp/SDKSampleLibrary/class1.cs#onstarclasshandler)] [!code-vb[ClassHandling#OnStarClassHandler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClassHandling/visualbasic/sdksamplelibrary/class1.vb#onstarclasshandler)]

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void InvokeEventHandler (Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void InvokeEventHandler(class System.Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub InvokeEventHandler (genericHandler As Delegate, genericTarget As Object)
protected: virtual void InvokeEventHandler(Delegate ^ genericHandler, System::Object ^ genericTarget);
abstract member InvokeEventHandler : Delegate * obj -> unit override this.InvokeEventHandler : Delegate * obj -> unit

param.name: genericHandler
param.span: 要调用的泛型处理程序/委托实现。

span.span: The generic handler / delegate implementation to be invoked.

param.name: genericTarget
param.span: 应在其上调用所提供的处理程序的目标。

span.span: The target on which the provided handler should be invoked.

summary.span: 当在派生类中重写时，提供特定于类型的调用事件处理程序的方式，该方式与基实现相比可提高效率。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, provides a way to invoke event handlers in a type-specific way, which can increase efficiency over the base implementation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此基实现合并了反射, 以确定处理程序不是按原义处理的任何情况的正确处理程序, 并且此反射步骤会对性能产生一些后果。The base implementation incorporates reflection to determine the right handler for any case where the handler is not literally , and this reflection step does have some performance consequences. 通过不依赖于反射, 可以更高效地进行调用。Invocations can be made more efficient by not relying on reflection. 这是激发此方法可用于任何路由事件参数类的方案, 可选择重写此方法。This is the scenario that motivates this method being available for any routed event arguments class that choose to override it. 实现不应调用此方法的基, 因为你的实现应已负责调用类型安全处理程序。Implementations should not call the base for this method, because your implementation should already be responsible for invoking the type safe handlers. ## Examples 下面的伪代码演示可用于实现的基本模式。The following is pseudocode that illustrates a basic pattern that can be used for implementation. 此处, `MyRoutedEventHandler`是的子类。Here, `MyRoutedEventHandler` is a subclass of . [!code-csharp[CorePseudocode#RoutedEventArgs](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CorePseudocode/CSharp/corepseudocode.cs#routedeventargs)] [!code-vb[CorePseudocode#RoutedEventArgs](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CorePseudocode/visualbasic/corepseudocode.vb#routedeventargs)]

para.span: 此方法旨在由派生的事件数据类重写, 以提供更高效的委托调用。

span.span: This method is intended to be overridden by derived event data classes to provide more efficient invocation of their delegates.

para.span: 实现应将提供的强制转换为特定于类型的委托, 然后调用该处理程序。

span.span: The implementation should cast the provided to the type-specific delegate, and then invoke that handler.

para.span: 默认实现将尝试调用所提供的处理程序, 并尝试将其强制转换为。

span.span: The default implementation will attempt to invoke the provided handler, attempting to cast it as .

para.span: 如果或作为提供,则将引发异常。

span.span: If either or is provided as , exceptions will be raised.

span.span: The new value that is being set to.

summary.span: 在派生类中重写时，每当实例的 属性的值发生更改，则提供一个通知回调入口点。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, provides a notification callback entry point whenever the value of the property of an instance changes.

para.span: 以编程方式更改事件的报告源可能需要更新事件内特定于类型的数据。

span.span: Changing the reported source of an event programmatically can potentially require updating the type-specific data within the event.

para.span: 出于此原因, 此方法是受保护的虚拟方法, 旨在由的子类重写。

span.span: For this reason, the method is protected virtual and is intended to be overridden by subclasses of .
This method has no default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OriginalSource As Object
public: property System::Object ^ OriginalSource { System::Object ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 在父类进行任何可能的 调整之前，获取由纯命中测试确定的原始报告源。

span.span: Gets the original reporting source as determined by pure hit testing, before any possible adjustment by a parent class.

value.span: 在类处理可能对展平复合元素树进行任何 调整之前的原始报告源。

span.span: The original reporting source, before any possible adjustment made by class handling, which may have been done to flatten composited element trees.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性将在调用类事件处理程序或任何实例处理程序之前获取其值一次, 在此之后永远不会进行调整。This property acquires its value once, before the class event handlers or any instance handlers are invoked, and is never adjusted past this point. 原始源信息对类处理程序或类实现是只读的, 与事件数据中报告的信息相同。The original source information is read-only to class handlers or class implementations, just as it is reported in the event data. 源可以调整的常见情况是控件的内容模型内的内容元素 (例如, 列表项的内容将报告列表项元素为 , 而列表项中的实际元素将是.Common cases where the source may be adjusted include content elements inside a content model for a control (the contents of a list item, for instance, will report the list item element as the and the actual element within the list item will be the . 各种元素和内容模型的源调整因类而异。Source adjustment by various elements and content models varies from class to class. 每个调整事件源的类都尝试预见哪个源最适用于大多数输入方案和类所需的方案, 然后将该源设置为。Each class that adjusts event sources attempts to anticipate which source is the most useful to report for most input scenarios and the scenarios for which the class is intended, and then sets that source as the . 如果此源不是与事件处理相关的源, 请改为查看它是否报告更适合的其他源。If this source is not the one that has relevance to your handling of the event, try checking instead to see if it reports a different source that is more suitable. 有关输入事件的更多详细信息, 请参阅[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more details on input events, see [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md).

summary.span: 获取或设置与此 实例关联的 。

span.span: Gets or sets the associated with this instance.

value.span: 已调用的事件的标识符。

span.span: The identifier for the event that has been invoked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不能对已路由的 (例如, 如果通过处理程序获取了参数) 设置此值。You cannot set this value on a that has already been routed (for instance, if you obtained the arguments through a handler). 如果尝试这样做, 将生成异常。Attempting to do so will generate an exception. 只能在尚未用于生成事件调用的实例上设置此方法。You can only set it on an instance that has not yet been used to generate an invocation of the event. 的值不能随时`null`处于。The value of cannot be `null` at any time. ## Examples 下面的示例使用初始构造函数创建新的路由事件数据, 然后将该属性设置为后续操作。The following example creates new routed event data with an initial constructor and then sets the property as a subsequent operation. 您必须先设置, 才能引发路由事件。You must have set prior to raising the routed event. [!code-csharp[ColorPicker_v2#RoutedEventArgsRoutedEvent](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ColorPicker_v2/CSharp/ColorPicker.cs#routedeventargsroutedevent)] [!code-vb[ColorPicker_v2#RoutedEventArgsRoutedEvent](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ColorPicker_v2/visualbasic/colorpicker.vb#routedeventargsroutedevent)]

exception.span: 在路由事件时试图更改 值。

span.span: Attempted to change the value while the event is being routed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ Source { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };
member this.Source : obj with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 获取或设置对引发事件的对象的引用。

span.span: Gets or sets a reference to the object that raised the event.
The object that raised the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于任何浮升路由事件的实际经过引发，它的元素之外的路由，并为任何隧道路由事件不具有尚未挖掘引发它的值的元素到的值与不同`sender`参数的事件参数类。For any bubbling routed event that has actually traveled the route beyond the element that raised it, and for any tunneling routed event that has not yet tunneled down to the element that raised it, the value of will be different than the value of the `sender` parameter of the event arguments class. 事件中涉及的两个元素中有哪些是最重要的: 任何给定处理程序(、引发它的元素或`sender`当前正在处理它的元素) 都依赖于处理程序的应用程序逻辑。寻址.Which of the two elements involved in the event is of the most importance in any given handler (, the element that raised it, or `sender`, the element that is currently handling it) is dependent on the application logic that your handler is addressing. 通常仅在重写或实现调整事件源的其他[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] (如处理事件的类时), 才能设置此属性。Setting this property is typically only done when overriding or implementing other [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] that adjust event sources, such as when class handling an event. 不建议通过实例处理程序重置明显的事件源, 特别是当处理程序未将事件标记为已处理时。Resetting apparent event sources from instance handlers is not recommended, particularly when the handler does not mark the event as handled. 如果重置以报告不同的事件源, 则会继续将源报告为初始调用引发的第一个。If you do reset to report a different event source, will continue to report the source as first raised by the originating call.
